newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: N.Korean defector to leave Philippines on Sunday.
newsitem.headline: N.Korean defector to leave Philippines on Sunday.

text.p: A senior North Korean defector taking refuge in the Philippines will arrive in South Korea on Sunday, South Korean government sources said.
Hwang Jang-yop, the most senior Pyongyang official ever to flee the impoverished North, would be flown to South Korea on a special plane, the sources said on Saturday.

"You can expect an announcement tomorrow morning after Hwang Jang-yop leaves the Philippines," a government source said. "There will, of course, be another announcement after he arrives in our country."
Hwang has been sheltering at an undisclosed hideout in the Philippines since March 18 after arriving there via Beijing.
Hwang, chief architect of North Korea's governing ideology of "juche", a creed of self-reliance, arrived in South Korea's consulate in Beijing on February 12 before being spirited to the Philippines.
